snippet: Republicans who control the State Assembly unanimously voted to remove the majority leader from his post Tuesday amid allegations that he had groped a woman.
abstract: Republicans who control Wisconsin State Assembly unanimously vote to remove majority leader, Rep Bill Kramer, from his post amid allegations that he had groped a woman and verbally abused another during a trip to Washington.
lead_paragraph: Republicans who control the State Assembly unanimously voted to remove the majority leader from his post Tuesday amid allegations that he had groped a woman.

headline.main: Wisconsin: Republicans Oust Leader Under Cloud
headline.print_headline: Wisconsin: Republicans Oust Leader Under Cloud
